items.sentence: I\'d rather clean my room than spend time doing my homework.
I\'m not going to be able to go to Boston with Tom tomorrow.
I\'m sure that Tom would be able to help me if he were here.
I\'m trying to stop Tom from making the same mistakes I did.
I\'ve never been to Boston. However, I have been in Chicago.
Tom couldn\'t answer even one question on yesterday\'s test.
You never told me that you didn\'t know how to speak French.
Are you seriously thinking about starting your own business?
Tom still doesn\'t know where he\'s going to go next summer.
I let Tom know that I was dissatisfied with his performance.
I never thought I would have to support such a large family.
I think the best way to learn English is to live in America.
I think this is the most impressive building on Park Street.
Put the book back on the shelf when you\'re through with it.
The only time Tom seems to be happy is when he\'s with Mary.
Unfortunately, Tom was in the wrong place at the wrong time.
We use gestures as well as words to communicate with others.
What makes you think that Tom prefers living in the country?
When I was a kid, we used to play hide and seek quite a lot.
When are you going to tell Tom that you want to get married?
